name: Noetherian ring
rephrased: A Noetherian ring is one where any collection of ideals can be built from a finite number by taking intersections and summing up, or equivalently, where any ascending sequence of ideals eventually stabilizes.
implication_form: If a ring satisfies the ascending chain condition on its ideals (or left/right ideals), then it is a Noetherian ring.
solved_by: The concept is foundational in ring theory and is considered solved; it's a cornerstone definition.
